reviewText: This is just one of those comics on dvd. Idid not know that is what it was. The story is good. As all the street fighter without live action are. It looks like they are just blowing this up frame by frame. If you like comics read to you by dvd this is your product if not buy ths book.

This product was everything i thought it would be; awesome.
 I especially liked the way the scenes were created, very inovative.
 I am a huge street fighter fan and i can honestly say this is worth getting.

This is my first experience with animated comics. The art is spectacular. There is a fair amount of animation, such as a character flying across the screen when he kicks, debris flying around, or Ryu's headband waving in the air. The characters' mouths don't move though. Still, thanks to the option to watch it with or without voice bubbles, this is practically like watching a cartoon. The story is very mature and well-written, much better than any of the Street Fighter animes in my opinion. Characters from Street Fighter 2, 4, and Alpha all make appearances.

My one major criticism is the voice acting. The actors are all terrible and they mispronounce virtually every name and special move (Gouken's name sounding the worst). Ken's wife Eliza has been given a phony southern accent for no discernible reason, but at least her voice actor is actually a female. If I had to choose between the animated Watchmen comic's single voice actor or a bunch of crummy voice actors, I'd go with Street Fighter's janitors, I mean actors. The sound effects and music are good, thankfully.

I recommend this for people who want to see the comic brought to life or just Street Fighter fans in general.

To call this a movie, much less an animation is a joke.  What this travesty is, is a comic book, frame by frame without the speech bubbles or flavor text, with the camera zooming in and out, moving around the frame.  I've seen some pretty crappy animation, but this?  This is grade A lazy.  I'm honestly surprised they hired voice actors for this.  I mean they didn't hire an animator for an animated movie...

Well I must say I was not like some of the reviewers.  I got this movie with Street Fighter: The Legend of Chun-Li Blu-Ray.  So I did not pay the price they are asking for.

Now for my review. (First ever Review)

The story line was good.  Animated comics seem pretty good.  But without the animation I used to do this as a kid to my friends.  They just added the animation and had more than one voice.  I know that some complained about the pronunciations.  But I will say it did better than me.

The good, Comics animated for our viewing pleasure.  Some voices match the charactors.  And for those who played Street Fighter 2 The New Challangers for the SNES.  Well we saw how some of the charactors storyline progressed.

The bad, lack of moving lips (but this was a comic afterall) Some voices did not match their Charactors (Vega for example did not sound Spanish) I would have prefered to see it without Chapter sceen popping up now and then.  Straight through would have been great.

As a huge fan of Udon and their Street Fighter series, I have to say, this is HORRIBLE! It's some of the worst voice acting I have ever heard in my life. I have no clue as to why they felt the need to make this. What? People are too lazy to read comic books now? It's terrible. Get the comics. Skip this.
